hanzi-su-wiki:
恵

Значения

Благоприятствовать; оказывать благодеяние, подавать милостыню, проявлять доброту; ум, мудрость; доброжелательность

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Приспосабливаться сердцем 心 к людям, как колеса у арбы 車 друг к другу.

Варианты

惠
purpleculture_pinyin:
huì
Japanese variant of 惠
Японский вариант хуэй
rtega_mnemonic:
惠惠RS
恵恵		favour, benefit, confer kindness
  • heart 心 giving a spindle 叀/𤰔 to someone concentrating 叀/𤰔 attention on someone: favour
heisig_constituent: favor, ten, needle, rice field, brains, heart
koohiiStory1: Too easy. Imagine the Wizard of OZ. There, the three heroes asked the Wizard for three FAVORS: the lion wanted courage of TEN men, the scarecrow wanted a BRAIN, and the tin man wanted a HEART. Ok, the lion bit is stretching but you have it memorized now, so who cares?
koohiiStory2: Do yourself a favor and take ten minutes to think about your decison...　RTK2:　エ　知恵　ちえ(wisdom)　　　ゴ　互恵　ごけい(reciprocal).
jp_example_words:
恵み(めぐみ): blessing
恵む(めぐむ): to bless, to show mercy to
恩恵(おんけい): grace, favor, blessing, benefit
知恵(ちえ): wisdom, wit, sagacity, sense, intelligence, advice
恵まれる(めぐまれる): be blessed with, be rich in
jp_readingExamples: 恵贈 (けいぞう), 恵与 (けいよ), 恩恵 (おんけい), 恵む (めぐ.む)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You carry a cross across a rice paddy with a heart on it to return a favor for your friend. The heart needs to be purified so that’s why you have it on the cross and your friend lives on a rice paddy farm so that’s why you’re running through that. The favor you are paying your friend back with is getting him this heart. He needs a new one and you’re providing it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: This is a pretty big favor. Imagine running through a rice paddy carrying a cross with a warm beating heart on it. Thump thump. Thump thump.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You arrive at your friend’s place and you can finally return the favor you owe him by presenting him with the heart. “Eh (え)? What’s this? I didn’t ask for this!” “Eh!?!?” you reply. Apparently he didn’t want a real heart, he wanted a candy one. He wanted a Valentine!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine how dumb you feel at this miscommunication. Eh? You don’t feel dumb? Well you should!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: one (一) reason (由) for a heart (心) is to bless

huì
яп. вм. 惠
Radicals: 十, 田, 心  (cross, rice-paddy, heart)
Meaning Mnemonic
You carry a cross across a rice paddy with a heart on it to return a favor for your friend. The heart needs to be purified so that’s why you have it on the cross and your friend lives on a rice paddy farm so that’s why you’re running through that. The favor you are paying your friend back with is getting him this heart. He needs a new one and you’re providing it.
This is a pretty big favor. Imagine running through a rice paddy carrying a cross with a warm beating heart on it. Thump thump. Thump thump.
Reading Mnemonic
You arrive at your friend’s place and you can finally return the favor you owe him by presenting him with the heart. “Eh (え)? What’s this? I didn’t ask for this!” “Eh!?!?” you reply. Apparently he didn’t want a real heart, he wanted a candy one. He wanted a Valentine!
Imagine how dumb you feel at this miscommunication. Eh? You don’t feel dumb? Well you should!
